title: INF: Design and Implement Terraform Workspaces and VPC Networking
description: Configure Terraform S3 backend and establish workspaces for dev, staging, prod. Implement Terraform modules for VPC, subnets across 2 AZs, NAT Gateways, and foundational security groups.
sprint_goal: Establish foundational cloud infrastructure and core application shell with basic calculator functionality.
acceptance_criteria: Terraform workspaces `dev`, `staging`, `prod` are created and functional. VPC, public/private subnets, and route tables are successfully provisioned via `terraform apply`.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Terraform plan validated; Successful apply to dev environment; Documentation updated.
testing_requirements: Validation in AWS Console.
deployment_notes: Project starting point. Blocks all other infrastructure.
business_value: Enables all future cloud deployments and application hosting.

title: INF: Provision Multi-AZ RDS PostgreSQL and Secrets Manager
description: Using Terraform, provision a PostgreSQL 15+ RDS instance with Multi-AZ, automated snapshots (14-day retention), PITR, and encryption at rest. Store master credentials in AWS Secrets Manager.
sprint_goal: Establish foundational cloud infrastructure and core application shell with basic calculator functionality.
acceptance_criteria: RDS instance is provisioned and accessible from within the VPC. Multi-AZ and encryption at rest are confirmed enabled. A secret is created in Secrets Manager containing the DB credentials.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Terraform plan validated; Successful apply to dev environment.
testing_requirements: Validation of RDS settings in AWS Console.
deployment_notes: Requires VPC and private subnets to be created first.
business_value: Provides the persistent data store for the application.

title: INF: Configure AWS Cognito User Pool
description: Using Terraform, define the Cognito User Pool with the specified strong password policy, App Client configured for OAuth 2.0 with PKCE, and required user attributes.
sprint_goal: Establish foundational cloud infrastructure and core application shell with basic calculator functionality.
acceptance_criteria: Cognito User Pool is created. Password policy matches REQ-1-071. App Client is configured with a callback URL and PKCE enabled.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Terraform plan validated; Successful apply to dev environment.
testing_requirements: Validation of User Pool settings in AWS Console.
deployment_notes: Can be developed in parallel with networking.
business_value: Provides the identity management system for user authentication.

title: FE: Design and Implement Responsive App Shell
description: Create the main `Layout.tsx` component using Material-UI's Grid, AppBar, and Drawer components. Define theme breakpoints for mobile, tablet, and desktop. Implement a responsive header that collapses to a hamburger menu on mobile.
sprint_goal: Establish foundational cloud infrastructure and core application shell with basic calculator functionality.
acceptance_criteria: The main layout structure is in place. Navigation collapses into a functional Drawer on viewports < 768px. The layout is fluid and does not require horizontal scrolling at 375px, 768px, or 1280px widths.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; E2E viewport tests passing; Accessibility audit clean.
testing_requirements: Manual testing across breakpoints, Cypress viewport tests.
deployment_notes: Foundational UI component for the entire application.
business_value: Enables a consistent user experience across all devices.

title: FE: Set Up React Router and Placeholder Routes
description: Integrate React Router to manage client-side navigation. Create placeholder components for the main calculator page, settings, and other future routes, and wrap them in the responsive Layout component.
sprint_goal: Establish foundational cloud infrastructure and core application shell with basic calculator functionality.
acceptance_criteria: The application uses `BrowserRouter` for routing. User can navigate between `/`, `/settings`, and `/login` routes. The responsive `Layout` component is applied to all main routes.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; E2E tests for route changes are passing.
testing_requirements: Manual navigation in the browser; Cypress tests for route changes.
deployment_notes: Required to structure the application's views.
business_value: Enables navigation between different features of the application.

title: FE: Integrate Math Expression Parser Library
description: Select, install, and configure a third-party math expression parser library (e.g., math.js). Create a wrapper service `calculator-engine.ts` that exposes a single `evaluate` function.
sprint_goal: Establish foundational cloud infrastructure and core application shell with basic calculator functionality.
acceptance_criteria: The `evaluate` function correctly computes '5+3*2' to 11. The function correctly handles division by zero by throwing a specific error.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing with >90% coverage.
testing_requirements: Unit tests for the engine.
deployment_notes: Core calculation logic for the entire application.
business_value: Provides the engine for all mathematical computations.

title: FE: Develop Calculator Display and Keypad Components
description: Create the main UI components for the calculator, including the display for the expression/result and the grid of buttons for numbers and operators, using Material-UI.
sprint_goal: Establish foundational cloud infrastructure and core application shell with basic calculator functionality.
acceptance_criteria: Keypad and Display components are rendered. Clicking buttons appends characters to the expression state. Components are responsive.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Component tests passing; Accessibility audit clean.
testing_requirements: Component tests and manual verification.
deployment_notes: Depends on the main application layout.
business_value: Provides the primary user interface for the calculator.

title: FE: Implement History Panel Component
description: Create a React component to display the calculation history. It should read from the Redux store, display an empty state message, and become scrollable when content overflows.
sprint_goal: Establish foundational cloud infrastructure and core application shell with basic calculator functionality.
acceptance_criteria: Component renders a list of history items from the Redux store. An empty state message is shown when the history array is empty. A vertical scrollbar appears when the list items exceed the container height.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Component tests passing.
testing_requirements: Component tests and manual verification.
deployment_notes: Depends on the Redux store being set up.
business_value: Allows users to review their previous calculations.

title: FE: Integrate History Logic with Calculator
description: Modify the calculator's Redux slice to store a history of calculations. After each successful evaluation, the expression and result should be added to the history array.
sprint_goal: Establish foundational cloud infrastructure and core application shell with basic calculator functionality.
acceptance_criteria: After pressing '=', a new entry is added to the `history` state in Redux. The history is maintained in reverse chronological order. History is session-based for anonymous users.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests for reducer logic are passing.
testing_requirements: Redux DevTools inspection and E2E tests.
deployment_notes: Connects the calculation engine outcome to the history UI.
business_value: Provides the logic for populating the user's calculation history.

title: CI: Create Backend CI Workflow
description: Create a GitHub Actions workflow for the backend service. It should trigger on push, install dependencies, run lint, unit tests, and integration tests, and check for code coverage.
sprint_goal: Automate the delivery pipeline and implement the complete user authentication system.
acceptance_criteria: Workflow runs on every push to a non-main branch. Job fails if lint, test, or code coverage checks fail.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Workflow successfully runs in GitHub Actions.
testing_requirements: Successful and failing workflow runs in GitHub Actions.
deployment_notes: Blocks automated security scanning and deployment.
business_value: Enables continuous integration for the backend service.

title: CI: Integrate SAST, SCA, and Container Security Scans
description: Add steps to the backend CI workflow to perform Static Application Security Testing (SAST) with CodeQL, Software Composition Analysis (SCA) with `npm audit`, and container scanning with Trivy.
sprint_goal: Automate the delivery pipeline and implement the complete user authentication system.
acceptance_criteria: CodeQL scan is configured and runs. `npm audit` is executed and fails on critical vulnerabilities. Trivy scans the Docker image and fails on critical vulnerabilities.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Workflow logs show successful scan execution.
testing_requirements: Workflow logs showing successful execution and correct failure on detected vulnerabilities.
deployment_notes: Security scans are part of the CI quality gate.
business_value: Automates security vulnerability detection early in the development lifecycle.

title: FE: Develop Registration UI Form
description: Create the React component for the user registration form, including fields for email, password, password confirmation, and a ToS checkbox. Implement comprehensive client-side validation.
sprint_goal: Automate the delivery pipeline and implement the complete user authentication system.
acceptance_criteria: Form renders with all required fields. Validation errors for invalid email, weak password, and mismatched passwords are shown in real-time. 'Register' button is disabled until all fields are valid.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Component tests passing.
testing_requirements: Component tests and manual verification.
deployment_notes: The form will be part of the main application layout.
business_value: Provides the user interface for new user onboarding.

title: FE: Implement Cognito Registration Flow (PKCE)
description: Integrate the frontend with the Cognito User Pool for registration. This involves creating the service logic to handle the OAuth 2.0 Auth Code with PKCE flow, from initial redirect to handling the callback.
sprint_goal: Automate the delivery pipeline and implement the complete user authentication system.
acceptance_criteria: Submitting the registration form initiates the correct OAuth flow. A new user is successfully created in the Cognito User Pool. Upon successful registration, the user is automatically logged in and redirected.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; E2E tests for registration are passing.
testing_requirements: E2E tests using Cypress.
deployment_notes: Connects the UI to the backend Cognito service.
business_value: Implements the core logic for user account creation.

title: FE: Develop Login UI and Post-Login Data Fetching Logic
description: Create the Login UI form component. Implement the logic that, upon successful authentication, triggers API calls to fetch user-specific data (history, variables, modes) and populates the Redux store.
sprint_goal: Automate the delivery pipeline and implement the complete user authentication system.
acceptance_criteria: Login form component is created. Successful login triggers GET requests to fetch user data. Redux store is correctly hydrated. Error states during data fetching are handled gracefully.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; E2E tests and Redux DevTools inspection confirm functionality.
testing_requirements: E2E tests and Redux DevTools inspection.
deployment_notes: Login extends the authentication service and requires data endpoints.
business_value: Allows returning users to access their accounts and data.

title: BE: Implement Backend Data Endpoints for User State
description: Develop the NestJS controllers, services, and DTOs for GET endpoints to retrieve a user's `calculation_history`, `user_variables`, and `custom_modes`. All endpoints must be secured.
sprint_goal: Automate the delivery pipeline and implement the complete user authentication system.
acceptance_criteria: GET `/api/v1/variables` is created and secured. The endpoint returns only data associated with the authenticated user. Attempting access without a token returns 401. Endpoints are documented via OpenAPI.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Integration tests passing for all endpoints.
testing_requirements: Passing integration tests.
deployment_notes: Backend endpoints are required for the frontend to fetch data.
business_value: Provides the secure API for retrieving personalized user data.

title: FE: Implement Ohm's Law Calculation Logic
description: Create a pure TypeScript function or class that takes an object with any two of {V, I, R, P} and returns an object with all four values calculated. Handle all six possible input combinations.
sprint_goal: Automate the delivery pipeline and implement the complete user authentication system.
acceptance_criteria: Given V and I, R and P are correctly calculated. Given R and P, V and I are correctly calculated. The logic correctly handles inputs of 0.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing with >90% coverage.
testing_requirements: Unit tests with comprehensive coverage of all 6 calculation paths.
deployment_notes: Self-contained logic module.
business_value: Provides the core calculation engine for a key electronics feature.

title: FE: Develop Ohm's Law UI Component
description: Create a React component with four managed input fields for V, I, R, and P. The component state should track which fields are user-entered vs. calculated. It should display a guidance message when fewer than two fields are filled.
sprint_goal: Automate the delivery pipeline and implement the complete user authentication system.
acceptance_criteria: Component renders four input fields. Component calls calculation logic when two valid inputs are present. Calculated fields are visually distinct. Guidance message is correctly shown/hidden.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Component tests passing.
testing_requirements: Passing component tests and manual verification in Storybook or dev environment.
deployment_notes: UI component consumes the calculation logic.
business_value: Provides the user interface for the Ohm's Law & Power calculator.

title: FE: Implement Service Worker for App Shell Caching
description: Configure and integrate a service worker (using Workbox via a Vite plugin) to cache the main application assets (HTML, JS, CSS).
sprint_goal: Deliver offline capabilities and the foundational custom mode creation wizard.
acceptance_criteria: A service worker is registered on application load. After the first visit, the app shell can be loaded from cache while offline. A cache-busting strategy is in place for new deployments.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; E2E tests for offline loading are passing.
testing_requirements: E2E testing with network throttling in Cypress.
deployment_notes: Requires the core app components to exist to be cached.
business_value: Enables the application to load and function without an internet connection.

title: FE: Implement Offline Queue with IndexedDB
description: Create a service (`offline-queue.ts`) using Dexie.js to manage a queue of pending API requests in IndexedDB. Implement Redux middleware to intercept failing API calls (due to network error) and write them to this queue.
sprint_goal: Deliver offline capabilities and the foundational custom mode creation wizard.
acceptance_criteria: When an API POST fails due to network error, the action is caught. A new record is created in the IndexedDB 'pendingRequests' table. The UI optimistically reflects the change.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing for middleware; Manual verification of IndexedDB storage.
testing_requirements: Inspecting IndexedDB storage in browser dev tools.
deployment_notes: Offline queue intercepts calls to real API endpoints.
business_value: Provides the mechanism to store user actions performed while offline.

title: FE/BE: Implement Sync and Conflict Resolution Logic
description: On the frontend, add logic to listen for the 'online' event and process the IndexedDB queue. On the backend, update `user_variables` endpoints to handle timestamps for a 'last-write-wins' conflict resolution strategy.
sprint_goal: Deliver offline capabilities and the foundational custom mode creation wizard.
acceptance_criteria: When browser comes online, pending requests are sent. Backend correctly handles append-only and mutable data. Frontend handles 409 Conflict by refreshing state.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; E2E tests for the full offline-online cycle are passing.
testing_requirements: E2E tests that simulate the full offline-online cycle.
deployment_notes: The sync process consumes the queue created in the previous task.
business_value: Ensures data consistency and integrity when transitioning between online and offline states.

title: BE: Implement Backend for Custom Mode CRUD
description: In the NestJS service, create the TypeORM entity for `custom_modes` and the necessary CRUD endpoints (POST, GET, PUT, DELETE) in a new controller. Secure all endpoints.
sprint_goal: Deliver offline capabilities and the foundational custom mode creation wizard.
acceptance_criteria: `POST /api/v1/custom-modes` endpoint is functional and saves a new mode. Endpoints are protected. Validation is in place for name and uniqueness per user.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Integration tests passing for all endpoints.
testing_requirements: Passing integration tests.
deployment_notes: The backend must exist before the frontend can be built.
business_value: Provides the API for creating, managing, and persisting user-created calculation modes.

title: FE: Design and Implement Multi-Step Wizard Component
description: Create a reusable, multi-step wizard component in React. Implement the first step for defining the mode's name and description. Manage the wizard's state using a dedicated Redux slice.
sprint_goal: Deliver offline capabilities and the foundational custom mode creation wizard.
acceptance_criteria: A generic Wizard component is created. The first step of the custom mode wizard is implemented. Client-side validation for the Name field is functional. State is correctly managed.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Component tests passing.
testing_requirements: Component tests and manual verification.
deployment_notes: The wizard will submit data to the backend.
business_value: Provides the user interface for creating custom calculation modes.
